Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery type A cup; interior glazed black; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of foreparts of horses of quadriga to right with added red on manes and collar with faded added white dots below collar with end of goad above their backs.
Curator's comments: According to Venit, the vase is by the same hand and perhaps same cup as British Museum 1888,0601.594.e (incorrectly labelled by her as 1888,0601.594.c).
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 448, no. B743)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0622) (Phase 1)
